sub_title: Signal Officer at United States Army

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing key contracts and maintaining good business relationships to ensure high performance 
Responsible for determining the methods necessary to ensure effective  execution of the contracting and acquisition mission within the area of responsibility
Responsible for providing assistance in cost or price analysis, establishment of negotiation positions  and technical support
Meets Defense Acquisition University (DAU ) standards
Vast knowledge of using the FAR
Reviewing contracts for feasibility, compatibility and effectiveness in meeting requirements by inspecting or maintaining quality control in ensuring adequacy of contracts awarded
Analyzing and determining appropriate contract requirements, special provisions, terms and conditions to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, regulations and corporate policies
Collaborating with associates and synthesizing details into a comprehensive form to meet client needs
Facilitated in conducting qualitative & quantitative research to evaluate effectiveness, efficiency and productivity of projects/programs
Commended for creating and improving business processes in an operational environment
Hold the distinction of identifying potential improvements to program practices and procedures in order to enhance efficiency and quality
Serving as a business advisor to commanders by providing overall support on key administrative programs
Responsible for small business program implementation to include interfacing locally, regionally and nationally
profile_positions.title: Contracting/Signal Officer

profile_positions.description:
Successfully led training programs for 2000+ officers per year
Responsible for end to end facility management - arranged lodging, transportation, procuring facilities for the visitors
Successfully oversaw overall logistics for school and coordinated the transportation of materiel and vehicles
Responsible for $1,000,000+ in tactical vehicles and equipment
Managed inventory control activities and ensured vehicle readiness for any assignment 
Scheduled instructors and coordinated worldwide VIP visits by dignitaries and high-ranking officers
Responsible for providing support to commanders world-wide attending various programs or conferences 
Supervised 4 direct reports in managing and overseeing various training seminars and programs
Implemented new classes and seminars whenever required to prepare officers to command units in excess of 350 Marines
Managed maintenance activities of buildings and grounds for the Officer Candidate School with 15 direct reports
Trained in Environmental Compliance for Hazardous Materials and Hazardous Waste Site Workers
Responsible for monitoring various activities like painting, roofing, electrical and grounds work 
Procured and supervised outside contractors whenever required 
Provided advice to senior management (command) on the areas of improvement 
Interviewed contractors and recommended services to senior management
Ensured timely delivery whenever required internationally by coordinating shipping of materiel and vehicles with appropriate personnel  in the Navy 
Responsible for overseeing all vehicle maintenance
Successfully managed operations with safety, work quality and compliance
profile_positions.title: Program/Logistics/Facilities Manager
